TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national national , born in DATE and resident in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicant arrived in GPE on CARDINAL DATE with a visa at DATE . He married a NORP citizen on DATE . The applicant was refused a residence and work permit on DATE . He left GPE but returned again on DATE as he had been granted a residence and work permit in the Finnish Embassy of GPE on the basis of his marriage . The applicant was granted a further residence and work permit later on . The applicant and his first NORP wife divorced on DATE .

The applicant has committed several crimes during his stay in GPE . He has been sentenced to several suspended prison sentences and to community service . He has also been ordered to pay fines . According to the applicant he has not committed any crimes since DATE .

On DATE local police requested ORG ( ulkomaalaisvirasto , utlänningsverket ) to expel the applicant . ORG ordered on DATE that the applicant be expelled to GPE as he had no family ties in GPE and as he had repeatedly committed crimes for which the maximum penalty was DATE imprisonment . The applicant was also forbidden by the decision of ORG to enter GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE or GPE for DATE . The applicant appealed against the decision to ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) , stating that there were no legal reasons for his expulsion as the crimes he had committed were not serious enough to justify such an expulsion and as his then girlfriend , T. , was pregnant . The applicant also alleged that he would be convicted of desertion and sentenced to a lengthy prison sentence in GPE , if expelled .
In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant married PERSON , who is a NORP citizen , and who was pregnant by the applicant . The applicant ’s daughter was born on DATE .

On DATE ORG refused the applicant ’s appeal . ORG found , taking into account the applicant ’s numerous convictions , that the applicant ’s expulsion was justified and lawful . It was also noted by the court that the applicant had not submitted any evidence concerning the alleged inhuman treatment in GPE , if expelled . ORG further stated that LAW does not guarantee to the spouse of a citizen a general right to be granted a residence permit . Taking into account , however , that the applicant ’s family lives in GPE , ORG reduced the period of the prohibition to enter GPE or other NORP countries to DATE from the original CARDINAL years’ prohibition .
B. Relevant domestic law and practice

According to Section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL , of LAW ( ulkomaalaislaki , utlänningslag CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , an alien can be expelled from GPE , inter alia , if he or she has committed an offence for which the minimum penalty is DATE imprisonment , or if he or she has repeatedly committed criminal offences .

According to LAW of LAW , the circumstances ( such as the length of the alien ’s stay in GPE , the existence of a parent - child relationship , family and other ties to GPE , or , in connection with LAW , subsection CARDINAL of the LAW , the nature of the offence or offences committed ) have to be taken into account as a whole when an expulsion is considered . No one may be expelled to an area where he or she might risk being subjected to inhuman treatment or persecution , nor to another area from which he or she might be sent to such an area .

According to Section CARDINAL of LAW , the expulsion is decided by ORG if so requested by police . ORG may in some exceptional circumstances decide an expulsion even if the measure is not requested by the police . The alien concerned must also be given an opportunity to be heard in the matter .

According to LAW of LAW , an alien may be prohibited from entering the country for a maximum of DATE or for an indefinite period . The prohibition may be cancelled permanently or for the time being , because of a change in circumstances or important personal reasons . Such a cancellation is decided by ORG .
According to LAW of LAW , decisions of ORG concerning , inter alia , expulsion orders , may be appealed within DATE before ORG .
